dataset.title: Sikfokut LTER (Hungary) - habitat characteristics - EnvEurope A5

creator.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

metadataProvider.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

section.para: This dataset provides data on habitat and management type of Síkfőkút LTER site (Hungary). Observed natural disturbance events (drought, folivory) covering the period 2003-2012 are also listed.

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:EnvEurope (LTER-Europe) has granted a permission of type:Other restrictions according to rules defined in itellectual rights
Co-authorship on publications resulting from use of the dataset
The opportunity to collaborate on the project using the dataset

contact.organizationName: University of Debrecen, Faculty of Science and Technology, Dpt. Botany

para.literalLayout: Habitat type was determined according to the Council Directive 92/43/EEC on the Conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora. The site is characterized as unmanaged, since it is protected by law as nature conservation area. Natural disturbances: grazing: visual observation of insect bursts and defoliation. droughts: calculation of monthly De Martonne aridity indices using monthly sum precipitation and monthly mean temperature data as follows: prec/(temp+10)*12. Months with Idx DM lower than 20 (semi arid or dry) were considered as dry periods.

methodStep.instrumentation: Weather data were measured by the site's own meteorological staition at 25m above ground: Hobo ProSeries RHandTemp sensor and Hobo Micro Station with rain gaugue (Onset Computer Corporation, Pocasset, USA)

section.para: This dataset is considered to be representative of the whole 28 ha area of Sikfokut LTER site. Daily mean temperatures and sums of precipitation were converted to monthly data.
